pages.text: When I set out to create a sigil that could extract the souls from creatures without harming them, I should have considered what would happen to their soulless body. Maybe then I wouldnt have had to see... that.$(br2)On a more positive note, I managed to modify the sigil to move creatures around easily instead.

Using the sigil on an entity will cause it to be absorbed into the sigil. Up to 5 creatures can be absorbed, and they can be released one at a time by using the sigil on a block.$(br2)It should be noted that hostile creatures seem to be immune the effect of this sigil.

It does bother me that I cannot see what happens to the creatures when they are absorbed into the sigil. I have a theory, that there is a sort of 'space' within every soul. Accessing this space could prove beneficial, as my time here grows thin. The townspeople, I don't know how they know, but they do. I have been questioned more and more in recent weeks, and I fear they will force their way in here soon. $(4)I should look into improving this sigil to let me access the space within,
$(4)lest I face execution for all the things I have done...
